page.title: 04 Long Bennington
page.content: {Local History: Bronze Age}people were the first known settlers in the area. of Long Bennington. It is thought that there have been at least two Roman sites in{Long Bennington.}When{William {the Conqueror}sent his{Domesday Scouts round, they found "a priest with a church" at Long Bennington. The priest was under the auspices of the{Abbey of {Savigny.}During the Civil War,{Newark (7 mls.North) was a{Royalist {Stronghold}and{Grantham}(8 mls.South) was{Parliamentarian.}Long Bennington was plundered by both sides. {Village Hall: Mrs. Grote_Joyce}lived in the Manor House (now the Manor Hotel). She disliked the local vicar so she had her own church built near her house. She also employed her own vicar.After her death the church was given to the village.
